original_title: Sri Lanka cabinet clears banking special provisions bill
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s cabinet had approved the draft to enact a Banks (Special Provisions) Act, Trade Minister Bandula Gunawardana said.
Sri Lanka’s Attorney General had cleared the bill prepared by the legal draftsman.
The law is expected to increase the central bank’s crisis management powers, and was expected to have been passed by parliament in April.
An entirely new Banking Act is to be passed by cabinet in June 2023 and approved by parliament as in December 2023 as structural benchmarks.
Sri Lanka’s banks have been hit by a combination of bad loans, mark-to-market losses and sovereign bond losses. (Colombo/May04/2023)
